name: pomp
content:
pomp noun
(CEREMONY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] impressive and colourful ceremonies, especially traditional ceremonies on public occasions: The prime minister was received with all the traditional pomp and ceremony that is laid on for visiting heads of government. Despite all the pomp of his office/position, he has only limited powers. in sb's pomp
informal at a time when someone was most successful or popular: Today his game was reminiscent of that of Pele in his pomp. pomp and circumstance
formal ceremonies: After two hours of pomp and circumstance, the diplomas were awarded and the audience went wild.
